nodes.bodyText: This appears to be a change in behavior, as the original code copied to ${TMP_DIR}. Why the change?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -172,13 +172,11 @@ SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 OR GPL-2.0 WITH Classpath-excepti
 			</then>
 			<else>
 				<shellscript shell="bash" dir="${TMP_DIR}">
-					mkdir ${TMP_DIR}/debugtools
-					cp -af ${WORKSPACE}/debugtools/DDR_* ${TMP_DIR}/debugtools
-					cp -af ${WORKSPACE}/jcl ${TMP_DIR}
-					cp -af ${WORKSPACE}/../build/RAS_Binaries/*.jar ${TMP_DIR}/RAS_Binaries
-					mkdir ${TMP_DIR}/sourcetools/
-					cp -af ${WORKSPACE}/sourcetools/lib ${TMP_DIR}/sourcetools/
-					cp -af ${WORKSPACE}/sourcetools/*.mk ${TMP_DIR}/sourcetools/
+					mkdir -p debugtools/ RAS_Binaries/ sourcetools/
+					cp -af ${WORKSPACE}/jcl ./

nodes.bodyText: It's not a change in behavior: the commands are executed in the directory named ${TMP_DIR} - see line 174.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -172,13 +172,11 @@ SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 OR GPL-2.0 WITH Classpath-excepti

+					mkdir -p debugtools/ RAS_Binaries/ sourcetools/
+					cp -af ${WORKSPACE}/jcl ./

nodes.bodyText: Ok, but originally the script wasn't dependent on the cd, and now it is. This doesn't seem like an improvement.
